item.title: Billiard Room & Dart Puzzle Solution in Blue Prince
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/billiard-room-dart-puzzle-solution-in-blue-prince/

On the way to Room 46, you‚Äôre likely to come across the Billiard Room. No, we‚Äôre not stopping for a quick game as we need to head into here so we can complete the ever-changing Darts puzzle, which offers free bonuses if you can complete it.

Blue Prince is a game where I cherish the first few hours. Eventually, you come across the same rooms and items, and it becomes familiar. The initial wonderment comes from the beauty of exploration. You draft new rooms, see what they do and what they hold, and you find curiosities such as the Billiard Room.

Inside awaits a devious little puzzle. If you‚Äôre having trouble with it, don‚Äôt worry, I did at first. But once you understand its cunningness, it‚Äôs easily solvable.

How to Solve the Billiard Room Dart Puzzle in Blue Prince

We need to use the mathematical properties of Addition, Subtraction, Multiplication, and Division to select the correct numbers on the dart board and beat the puzzle.

In theory, with enough time and patience, you can solve the puzzle with a process of elimination. But it‚Äôs more fun and satisfying to work everything out for ourselves‚Äîand it would take hours!

You need to complete several stages of increasingly more difficult calculations and understand the colors to beat Blue Prince‚Äòs Dartboard test in the Billiard Room.

What do Dartboard Colors Mean in Blue Prince?

Below is a handy chart showing what each color means and how they influence the puzzle. You are likely to see one to complete the puzzle.

I haven‚Äôt seen any other colors during my playtime, but developer Dogubomb could always add more, or the late-game may feature further complications.

Dartboard Puzzle Example in Blue Prince

The puzzle, in my experience, has the same number of steps, and the equations become more difficult. Use the numbers on the inside of the board first and make your way to the outside of the board. Your answer should never be above 20.

Here‚Äôs an example of how to complete the puzzle:

  1. Interact with the dartboard to start the puzzle.
  2. The first step is likely to be a single blue number‚Äîthe answer is the highlighted number.
  3. So, if 14 is highlighted blue, the answer is 14 to start.
  4. Next, 6 could be highlighted in yellow, with 14 still blue.
  5. 14 minus 6 equals 8, so press this number.
  6. 8 could be in blue next, with the number 2 highlighted in pink.
  7. If we take 8 and multiply it by 2, we get 16.
  8. Say the number 18 is in blue and 3 is purple now, we divide 18 by 3 to get 6.
  9. For the next step, 20 is blue, 10 is yellow, 2 is pink, and 4 is purple.
  10. This means 20 minus 10 equals 10. Then 10 multiplied by 2 equals 20 again, and then 20 divided by 4 equals 5!

Let us know how you get on with the Dartboard puzzle in the Billiard room. It‚Äôs tough to understand at first, but it becomes a challenging brainteaser to keep you on your toes in Blue Prince. We have more handy guides, including how to get more Steps, Keys, and how to open the Boudoir Safe.

item.title: Three Sega Genesis Games Added To Nintendo Switch Online
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/three-sega-genesis-games-added-to-nintendo-switch-online/

Three more Sega Genesis games have been added to the console library for Nintendo Switch Online members.

Joining the service this month are classic games Streets of Rage, Super Thunder Blade, and ESWAT: City Under Siege. To play these games, along with other Sega Genesis titles, you‚Äôll need to have an active Nintendo Switch Online + Expansion Pack subscription.

In addition to Sega Genesis games, subscribers to Nintendo‚Äôs highest online tier also get access to Game Boy Advance and Nintendo 64 titles. When the Nintendo Switch 2 launches, GameCube games will also become available.

Nintendo Switch Online costs $20 for the base plan that gives players access to online gaming, Nintendo Music, Cloud Saves, NES, SNES, and Game Boy games. Adding the Expansion Pack brings the yearly cost to $50. That includes the base features along with the aforementioned game libraries as well Mario Kart 8 Deluxe‚Äôs Booster Course Pass, Animal Crossing: New Horizons Happy Home Paradise pack, and more.

item.title: Indiana Jones and the Great Circle PS5 Pro Enhancements And Other Features Revealed
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/indiana-jones-and-the-great-circle-ps5-pro-enhancements-and-other-features-revealed/

Indiana Jones and the Great Circle is set to release on PlayStation 5 (PS5) on April 17, and with it comes enhancements for the game on the PS5 Pro.

In a post on the PlayStation Blog, Bethesda went into details on what players with the high-end console will get when they load up the game.

Indiana Jones and the Great Circle will have native 4K resolution on the system along with advanced ray tracing features. The goal of the optimizations, per Bethesda, is to ensure players ‚Äúachieve higher and more consistent frame rates‚Äù.

‚ÄúPlaying Indiana Jones and the Great Circle at a native 4K resolution really is the best way to appreciate the level of detail the team at MachineGames has poured into every corner of the world,‚Äù production director John Jennings said via the post. ‚ÄúYou could spend hours just walking around the different environments admiring every little thing, from each artifact in Marshall College‚Äôs impressive collection to the verdant beauty of Sukhothai‚Äôs jungles.‚Äù

Other PS5 Features For Indiana Jones

Aside from the PS5 Pro enhancements, Indiana Jones and the Great Circle on PS5 will utilize the DualSense controller‚Äôs haptic feedback and adaptive triggers. The controller‚Äôs light bar will also give players visual feedback into Indy‚Äôs current status.

‚ÄúFor example, when you enter combat, the LED light around the touchpad will turn yellow, or pulse yellow if the NPCs are searching for you,‚Äù Bethesda‚Äôs Anne Lewis writes. ‚ÄúIf your health gets low, the light will pulse red until you heal up. Using a consumable to restore health like food or a bandage will turn the light green for a few seconds.‚Äù

Other features on the console include SSD optimization, 60 frames per second, 3D audio, HD rumble, and more.

Over 2 million citizens have explored Atomfall‚Äôs dangerous biomes, foraging for meat, drinking beer, and bonking druids on the head with cricket bats. The RPG is shaping up to be one of Rebellion‚Äôs greatest achievements‚Äîif not the greatest‚Äîand the developer has a ton of fun facts about the two million Atomfall players who‚Äôve played the game.

Atomfall is Rebellion‚Äôs most successful launch ever. This is a remarkable stat when you consider the company is probably best known for Sniper Elite. Nevertheless, the attempt to make a British-based RPG set around a nuclear disaster has paid dividends.

Players have spent the first few weeks exploring the land and raising hell. Once you‚Äôve raised enough hell, unlocked Radio Towers, and upgraded enough weapons, you need to kick back with a pasty and some tea.

Rebellion Reveals Incredible Atomfall Launch Stats

The Citizens of Wyndham (that tannoy announcement lives rent-free in my head) have been having their fill. According to an April 11 Rebellion post, over 2 million players have set foot in alternate-history Cumbria.

During their time, they‚Äôve found nearly 13 million Caches using the Metal Detector, killed six million enemies with classic Cricket Bat, ordered over a quarter of a million pints of beer, and scoffed 14 million tins of meat‚Äîand counting.
